Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is covered with a brown resinous deposit, the exterior, the lower section of which is ribbed, is covered with a cream-coloured slip and faint traces of one line of red-painted Coptic text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394296) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394296)
